body:
@MatthiasHerp Thanks for filing this. If you store your model in GitHub, i don't think you need to use `mlflow.xxx.log_model`.


```python
# train.py

model = train_model(...)
your_serialize_model_func(model, path)  # then, commit the serialized model
```

```python
# load.py

model  = your_load_model_func(path_to_serialized_model)
model.xxx(...)
```

`MLproject` would look like:


```yml
name: My Project

...

entry_points:
  train:
    ...
    command: "python train.py ..."
  load:
    ...
    command: "python load.py ..."
```

The Idea is that anyone can run the MLProject with the URI to create a model.  So when a user runs the MLProject the run stores the created model inside the artifacts of the run created locally. Then the user can acess the model for further use locally by loading it from he artifact Folder of the run.
In a sense similar to logging a model run from an example on Github.

heres a link to the python script of my MLProject:https://github.com/MatthiasHerp/ETS_Ex_BA_MLFlow/blob/master/train.py
At the Bottom you can see the Definition of the model class, the artifacts, the Environment and how I try to log or save this model
@MatthiasHerp Just to confirm, you don't store your model **in GitHub**, correct?
correct. I run the Project from GitHub and then want to store the model in the run Folder as an artifact

why don't you try running your project with the command below and see if it works?

```
mlflow run https://github.com/MatthiasHerp/ETS_Ex_BA_MLFlow.git ...
```

My Project is running. I just want to additionally store the created model every time I run the Project as the model is Always different since it depends on the Parameters i run the model with. Does that make sense?

I'll look into that:

> why don't you try running your project with the command below and see if it works?
> mlflow run https://github.com/MatthiasHerp/ETS_Ex_BA_MLFlow.git ...

But I dont think it is related to storing a model right?

> But I dont think it is related to storing a model right?

It is if your `train.py` logs a model.

Yes. But my Problem is with logging the custom model. I dont seem to get the python script right.
How would you log a custom model as an artifact of a run?

https://github.com/MatthiasHerp/ETS_Ex_BA_MLFlow/blob/master/train.py#L672

Doesn't this line log your model?
Yes it should but it doesn't, I'm getting an error back. So I'm wondering if I made made any mistake in logging the model or defining the artifacts
Can you provide the stack trace when you got an error?

Yes, I saved the stack trace as a MLFLow parameter in an exception.

The stack trace:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 677, in <module> mlflow.pyfunc.save_model(python_model=ETS_Exogen, conda_env=conda_env, artifacts=artifacts) TypeError: save_model() missing 1 required positional argument: 'path' 

So I tried defining a path. As i want to store the model locally in the artifact Folder of the run I used the following path:

#saving the run id to create path
run_id = run.info.run_id
#saving model in the artifact folder of the run
mlflow.pyfunc.save_model(str("runs:/"+run_id+"/artifact/model"),python_model=ETS_Exogen, conda_env=conda_env, artifacts=artifacts)

I also tried different paths such as:

str("runs:/"+run_id+"/model") 

"/model" #with and without dot at the beginning to signal a relativ path

"/artifact/model" #with and without dot at the beginning to signal a relativ path

The stack trace error was always:

Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 680, in <module> mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(str("runs:/"+run_id+"/artifacts/model"),python_model=ETS_Exogen, conda_env=conda_env, artifacts=artifacts) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\pyfunc\__init__.py", line 998, in log_model input_example=input_example, File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\models\model.py", line 161, in log mlflow.tracking.fluent.log_artifacts(local_path, artifact_path) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\tracking\fluent.py", line 328, in log_artifacts MlflowClient().log_artifacts(run_id, local_dir, artifact_path) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\tracking\client.py", line 290, in log_artifacts self._tracking_client.log_artifacts(run_id, local_dir, artifact_path) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\tracking\_tracking_service\client.py", line 288, in log_artifacts self._get_artifact_repo(run_id).log_artifacts(local_dir, artifact_path) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\store\artifact\local_artifact_repo.py", line 57, in log_artifacts mkdir(artifact_dir) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\utils\file_utils.py", line 111, in mkdir raise e File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\utils\file_utils.py", line 108, in mkdir os.makedirs(target) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\os.py", line 211, in makedirs makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\os.py", line 211, in makedirs makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\os.py", line 211, in makedirs makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\os.py", line 221, in makedirs mkdir(name, mode) OSError: [WinError 123] Die Syntax für den Dateinamen, Verzeichnisnamen oder die Datenträgerbezeichnung ist falsch: 'C:\\Users\\mah\\mlruns\\0\\54c00e8b874747a9b221da428ab53efe\\artifacts\\runs:' 

Which tells me that the path to log the model was incorrect

1. How would you set the path?

Heres the link to the documentation on the Topic of paths: 
https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/concepts.html#artifact-locations


My second Question is regarding the artifacts of my model. I would like to pull them directly from GitHub. So like this:

 artifacts = {
            "exogen_variables": os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)), "exogen_variables.csv")
        }

But according to the documentation a http link is not a valid Directory for a MLmodel artifact. Is there any work around?
Link to documentation: https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.pyfunc.html#pyfunc-create-custom

Thats why i get the stack trace: 

Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 677, in <module> mlflow.pyfunc.save_model("./model",python_model=ETS_Exogen, conda_env=conda_env, artifacts=artifacts) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\pyfunc\__init__.py", line 875, in save_model mlflow_model=mlflow_model, File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\pyfunc\model.py", line 156, in _save_model_with_class_artifacts_params artifact_uri=artifact_uri, output_path=tmp_artifacts_dir.path() File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\tracking\artifact_utils.py", line 80, in _download_artifact_from_uri return get_artifact_repository(artifact_uri=root_uri).download_artifacts( File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\store\artifact\artifact_repository_registry.py", line 102, in get_artifact_repository return _artifact_repository_registry.get_artifact_repository(artifact_uri) File "C:\Users\mah\Anaconda3\envs\mlflow-f4a9c66cbd381a72f7946866fb22ad9ff7f69fb1\lib\site-packages\mlflow\store\artifact\artifact_repository_registry.py", line 68, in get_artifact_repository artifact_uri, list(self._registry.keys()) mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Could not find a registered artifact repository for: c:. Currently registered schemes are: ['', 'file', 's3', 'gs', 'wasbs', 'ftp', 'sftp', 'dbfs', 'hdfs', 'viewfs', 'runs', 'models'] 

The only workaround I could think of is to log the file as an artifact in the run and then load it from there as an artifact into the model. Does that make sense?

@harupy That was what I was missing. Thank you. Now the model logs.

Do you have any Tipp for my second Issue?

@MatthiasHerp

This SO post might be helpful: https://stackoverflow.com/a/23464217/6943581. If you csv file is stored on GitHub, you can just use `pandas` (or `requests` for other file type) to pull it.
@harupy , that worked. Thank you very much :)
